attributes.action: Fire Iain Duncan Smith for the extreme failure of universal credit
attributes.additional_details: No benefit system will ever be perfect, however this one punishes those who seek work, the cost of phone calls alone from a PAYG mobile is a disgrace, especially as customers are having to call up every month chasing the benefits they have earned by seeking work or doing part time work. There is also a case of them hiding a fund for support to start work from those who need it and a case where they supported a fraudulent claim by a landlord for rent arrears not proven or entitled to them.
attributes.background: Anyone who has unfortunately had to deal with U/C will most likely understand.   The system is designed with no effort or care. Call centres cannot contact each other.  Complete waste of taxpayers money. Almost none of staff have a clue as different answers are given on each phone call.Unacceptable.

rejection.details: We can't accept petitions about appointments. If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or Parliament, you could start a petition about that.
